title: What did Joseph Stalin do for his country? - Quora

response.answer_text: He done many things and most of them is black & white: First about positive things: 1.Won WWII 2.Make living standards acceptable for most of Soviet people 3.His rule provided big order in country and corruption was almost equal to zero 4.USSR culture & science trough strong ideological limitations & influences still was one of the best in the world, in some branches even best in the world. 5.USSR economy under Stalin’s rule was fully independent and not dependent on any import. Than about negative things: 1.Great purge of 1937–38 killed & imprisoned huge amount (many millions) of innocent people. 2.Any kind of capitalistic, even small business economical activities was prohibited, which created great poverty & hunger in some places of USSR. 3. Humans loss in WWII was desaster for USSR and even today Russia experienced it. 4.Atmosphere of fear was usual on all levels of Soviet society.Even for small crime was possible to get many years in Gulag. 5. Science & culture was sometimes managed by people which have low education level in field or no education at all, which sometimes caused many controversies. 6. Stalins regime, which was officially leftist killed almost all left politicians from “main wave” of Oktyabr Revolution, many of them was Stalins friends or knows him well.He was main killer of Revolution and his new system while it was officially Marxist-Leninist was just parody on it. It was true totalitarian regime of one man power ,and main power was fear on all its levels.

Stalin pushed Russia forward out of the technological rut which it was heavily stuck in, and in some ways may have saved Russia from still being anarchy to this day. Why? Lenin met rebellion, quelled it, but died soon after. Then Stalin took over. If lenin hadn’t died, he would likely have met more rebellion. But after Stalin’s reign? The people still lived in fear, too afraid to try revolting, and fearing that someone else like Stalin would get power again. While we can’t say for certain, it’s perfectly possible that Russia could be stuck in the anarchy and wars that we see before Stalin’s reign.
